setting.info: OBLink server address
OBLink user
OBLink password
Database path for saving data
Duration in minutes used to calculate the contractility rate
Maximum value on the Y scale for the contractility graph
Number of contractions in the contractility rate that trigger the stage 1 color
Duration in minutes after which a stage 1 is upgraded to a stage 2 color in the contractility rate
Control code to decrypt the GE Centricity url parameters for the activex web page
Delete the episode files when they are closed (the file that contains the tracings, events and user actions)
If closed episode's data is to be deleted, how many days after last time the episode was monitored do we wait before actually deleting the data
A patient that is out of monitor will be automatically move to out of scope after xx hours
A patient that is out of monitor will be automatically move to close after xx hours
How many days of tracing in the past can be returned to the ActiveX
If the live tracing is more than xx seconds off from the current clock time, then mark the episode as late live
Minimum amount of physical memory required
Minimum number of physical cores required
After how many seconds without a chalkboard refresh do we set the 'offline' status
For trace, set to true so that debugging trace includes all patients information including PHI
Maximum number of past hours of tracings that will be retrieve from OBLink with the historical API
How often the Patterns Active X refreshes the data (in seconds)
If the user does not do it before, all dialog opened by the Patterns ActiveX will close automatically after xx minute(s)
Version of the ActiveX, if the current version does not match that, the user will be prompted to upgrade
Version of the active x required. Blank it to disable validation.
Minimum duration in hours between two iterations for the maintenance
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the refresh chalkboard
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the commit to database
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the collect tracings

How long (in seconds) the collection of tracing is allow to run at once. If there are many episode in recovery, do as many as possible withing that time and then move on to the next type of task. The remaining episodes will be done next round trip
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the compress tracings
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the refresh of the live tracings performance counters
File name of the catalog database
DB connection string format and options
Timeout in milliseconds for the chalkboard request to OBLink
How many retries in the update of the chalkbord if something wrong happened there before failing it
It happened that OBLink inverted patient chart answers, turn this key to True to detect this and ask again
Timeout in milliseconds for the patient data request to OBLink
Request used to retrieve the chalkboard from OBLink
Request used to retrieve the patient data from OBLink
Request used to retrieve the patient ADTLog from OBLink
Request used to retrieve the patient trail from OBLink
Request used to retrieve the tracing from OBLink
The base time used by OBLink to encode date and time
The format string used to parse the date and time of the columns header in the chart data returned by OBLink in the Trail chart
The format string used to parse the EDD date returned in the data chart by OBLink

For debugging, set to true so that debugging trace includes all requests and answers from OBLink for the charts. Be careful, this logs too much to be left turned on the logged data contains PHI information

For debugging, set to true so that debugging trace includes all information pertinent to chalkboard reconciliation (including a before and after). Be careful, this logs too much to be left turned on the logged data contains PHI information
For debugging, set to true so that debugging trace includes all requests and answers from the ActiveX. Be careful, this logs too much to be left turned on the logged data contains PHI information
Minimum amount of seconds of missing tracing to trigger the use of historical
Additional sleep time in milliseconds after each request of historical tracing, introduce to avoid stressing OBLink too much...
Additional sleep time in milliseconds after each request of live tracing, introduce to avoid stressing OBLink too much...
Minimum amount of seconds of missing tracing to trigger the use of historical
Maximum number of past seconds of tracings that will be retrieve from OBLink with the live API (must be higher than HistoricalTracingHasMoreTracingThreshold)
Maximum bridgeable gap for tracing when merging the small blocks returned by OBLink
Size in hours of the chunk of tracing that can be retrieved in one call to OBLink
How many retries before stopping the retrieval of the historical tracing of an episode
Timeout in milliseconds for opening request for historical tracing
Timeout in milliseconds for reading historical tracing in the stream
Timeout in milliseconds for opening request for live tracing
Timeout in milliseconds for reading live tracing in the stream
When switching to live tracing mode, it is necessary to have a little overlap (in seconds) to avoid gap
When switching to historical tracing mode, it is necessary to have a little overlap (in seconds) to avoid gap
Minimum gap in the tracing (in seconds) that will trigger a recycling of the detection engine
Priming buffer length in minutes when restarting an engine on an episode with existing tracings (useful on server restart mostly)
Minimum duration of new tracing before triggering a patterns detection
Maximum duration in second of a tracing that can be a candidate for a compression
The most xxx recents blocks are never compressed in cache in order to permit the incremental updates from ActiveX to work properly
Process the episode in random order when collecting the tracing ?
Timeout in seconds when stopping the service
Timeout in seconds when stopping the service to allow live tracing threads to stop
By default, only local IP client can access the Admin IP addresses on the web service and chalkboard
The maximum number of concurrent connections allowed by a ServicePoint object
The maximum idle time, in milliseconds, of a ServicePoint object.
URL to open the ActiveX from the chalkboard
URL to the service that provides the data for the ActiveX
URL to the service that provides the data for the chalkboard
URL to the service that provides the service of closing an episode (used from the chalkboard)
